item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 17, 2024 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. James Gleick's Chaos: The Software (62 points | 5 comments)
2. Meteorite 200 times larger than one that killed dinosaurs reset early life (86 points | 32 comments)
3. Teach Yourself to Echolocate (77 points | 18 comments)
4. The Bluesky firehose viewed in the style of a Windows XP screensaver (100 points | 43 comments)
5. SICP: The only computer science book worth reading twice? (2010) (259 points | 101 comments)
6. Two galaxies aligned in a way where their gravity acts as a compound lens (195 points | 58 comments)
7. James Webb Space Telescope finds evidence for alternate theory of gravity (243 points | 105 comments)
8. Logica – Declarative logic programming language for data (108 points | 36 comments)
9. Safety in an Unsafe World (12 points | discuss)
10. SmoothLLM: Defending Large Language Models Against Jailbreaking Attacks (27 points | 6 comments)
11. Show HN: I built a(nother) house optimized for LAN parties (480 points | 199 comments)
12. Xogot – Godot for iPad (12 points | 6 comments)
13. Two Nobel Prize winners want to cancel their own CRISPR patents in Europe (16 points | discuss)
14. Eau de Nil, the Light-Green Color of Egypt-Obsessed Europe (2018) (30 points | 6 comments)
15. Yggdrasil Network (241 points | 87 comments)
16. Stop making me memorize the borrow checker (117 points | 89 comments)
17. Netflix buffering issues: Boxing fans complain about Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson (415 points | 768 comments)
18. Statistical Rethinking (2024 Edition) (99 points | 20 comments)
19. JavaScript dos and donts Mu-An Chiou (22 points | 6 comments)
20. I tried every top email marketing tool (128 points | 74 comments)
21. Pentagon fails 7th audit in a row but says progress made (44 points | 18 comments)
22. Numpyro: Probabilistic programming with NumPy powered by Jax (80 points | 17 comments)
23. Resolving a mysterious problem with find (5 points | 3 comments)
24. Don't Look Twice: Faster Video Transformers with Run-Length Tokenization (50 points | 8 comments)
25. Optimizers: The Low-Key MVP (85 points | 5 comments)
26. IPv6 networks do apparently get probed (15 points | discuss)
27. The Difference Between a Standard DIMM and a Cudimm or Csodimm (31 points | 7 comments)
28. New haptic patch transmits complexity of touch to the skin (33 points | 5 comments)
29. C Compiler to SPIR-V (73 points | 7 comments)
30. Kyanos: eBPF-based network issue analysis tool (177 points | 14 comments)
